stem: Signs of congestive heart failure in children include all of the following EXCEPT
disc:
Symptoms of heart failure vary with age.
- Infants: tachypnea, diaphoresis, easy fatiguability, irritability, poor feeding, and weight gain
- Young children: GI symptoms (pain, vomiting, nausea), failure to thrive, easy fatiguability, chronic cough and wheezing
- Older children: exercise intolerance, anorexia, abdominal pain, wheezing, dyspnea, edema, palpitations, chest pain, or syncope

Physical examination may reveal
- Tachycardia
- Poor perfusion (cold peripheries, low systolic blood pressure)
- S3 gallop rhythm
- Tachypnea, crackles, and wheezing
- Hepatomegaly, splenomegaly
- Raised JVP and peripheral edema
